episode_title: 708 - The One Where Chandler Doesn’t Like Dogs

content.description: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s, Monica is in the kitchen, Joey, Rachel, and Phoebe are sitting around the table writing on notepads, while Chandler is looking over their shoulders.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey everybody! Happy Thanksgiving!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, no, no. No-no-no.

content.speaker: Joey, Rachel, and Phoebe
content.text: Shhhh!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What, are we keeping Thanksgiving a secret this year?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, we’re playing this game I learned at work. You have to name all the states in six minutes.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What? That’s like insanely easy!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Now, that’s a lot harder than it sounds. You always forget at least one, or in some cases… fourteen (looks over to Monica).

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s a stupid game and I wasn’t playing against other people, so technically I didn’t lose.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What? You forgot fourteen states?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Nobody cares about the Dakotas. (That’s true in so many ways, trust me, I’ve lived in one and been to the other.)
[Chandler’s watch beeps]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, okay, time’s up!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, I got 48.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh that’s not bad, Pheebs?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I got tired of naming states. So I decided to list the types of celery, and I have one: regular celery.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, so Rachel’s got 48 and Phoebe has the lead in…vegetables, Joey?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Say hello to the new champ of Chandler’s dumb states game.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wow, how many have you got?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Fifty-six!

content.description: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s. Ross is sitting in the couch doing Chandler’s game. Chandler is sitting in his barcalounger. The girls are in the kitchen.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! How is New England not a state? Huh? They have a sports team!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Does South Oregon have a sports-team? (Joey strikes one from his list) There you go.
[Cut to the girls in the kitchen.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: How come we have one extra place setting?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: ’Cause you invited your assistant.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, right. Sorry. But Tag’s not coming; his girlfriend came into town, so he’s spending Thanksgiving with her.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh! Why didn’t you tell me? I made him his own individual sweet potato stuffed pumpkin.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I was going to, but then I figured, you know… your food is so delicious and perfect, you can never have too many of those pumpkin things.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Now you think I wouldn’t enjoy that, because it is so fake, (Laughs) but I still do.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Regular Celery! (Starts to write that on her list) Oh, I already have that. (She gets up and heads for her room)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Done! With time-a to spare.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oooh that may be a New World’s record (Looks at his watch and picks up Ross’ pad)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You know, I hate to lecture you guys, but it’s kinda disgraceful, that a group of well-educated adults and Joey can’t name all the states. Did you ever see a map, or one of those round, colorful things called “a globe?” Hmm?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uh, Magellan? You got 46 states. (Smiles and hands Ross back his pad)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What? That’s impossible.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: 46. Wow! Who’s well educated now, Mr. I-forgot-ten-states?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, I’m out of oven space. I’m gonna turn on Joey’s. Please, watch him! Do not let Joey eat any of the food!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I am only one man! (Monica heads out) Okay Ross, time is up!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, just give me another minute.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look Ross, if you don’t know them by now, you will never know them, okay? That is the beauty of this game. It makes you want to kill yourself.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: This-this is crazy! I can do this! All right, uhh, I bet I can get all 50 before dinner.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, but if you can’t…no dinner!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You’re on!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right. Don’t look at my list, Ross, ’cause there’s a lot on there that you don’t have.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, did you guys know that your oven doesn’t work?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: But the drawer full of take-out menus is okay, right?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ross, I’m gonna use yours, okay?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Pshhshhh!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler? Can you give me a hand? (Grabs her jacket)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Sure, and Joey; do not let Ross look at any of the maps or the globe in your apartment.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Don’t worry, Chandler, it’s not a globe of the United States.
[Chandler and Monica head out with some stuff. Phoebe comes out of her room with a bag.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey you guys I’m gonna go out and take a walk.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Phoebe, why is your bag moving?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, it’s not!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Seriously, it’s moving!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What the hell is in there?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s just my knitting that’s all! (A dog sticks its head out of Phoebe’s bag. Everyone looks puzzled.) Yes! I knit this. I’m very good.

content.description: Ross’ apartment, Monica and Chandler enter.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ross’s apartment is nice! How come we don’t hang out here more often?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t know. Maybe it’s because it smells a little weird. It’s like old pumpkins or something.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s my pie!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Which smells delicious!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Uh-oh! Uh-oh!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We left Joey alone with the food! (Walks towards the window and looks out) Yep! Yep, I knew it! There he is… feeding stuffing to a dog!

content.description: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s, Ross is still doing his list. Rachel and Joey are feeding the dog as the phone rings.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi Geller-Bing residence. How can I help?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe, why is there a dog in our apartment?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m sorry, who’s this?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe, there’s a dog sitting on my couch!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Tell her, I’m allergic, and I will sue!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, there’s no dog here?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes there is! He’s black and white and shaggy and [Cut to Monica’s apartment] he’s sitting next to Rachel and licking Rachel’s hand.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my god! Where are you? (Looks around.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’ll be right there!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: They’re here already? How are they doing this?
content.parenthetical: Phoebe hangs up and someone knocks on the door. She gasps.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi Tag! What are you doing here?
content.parenthetical: gets up and opens the door

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: I, uh, wanted to see if your offer to spend Thanksgiving with you is still good.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, sure! Come in! (He enters) Well, what-what happened to your girlfriend?

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: We kinda broke up this morning.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Yeah, so she went back to Ohio.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ohio!! Thank you!
[Time lapse, Chandler and Monica enter.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Huh! Where is the dog?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What dog? There-there’s no dog here.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah that dog left!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe! Phoebe, open up!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: There’s no dog in here.
[The dog barks.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Phoebe, we can hear the dog barking!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No that’s just me coughing! (Doing some weird coughing noises and the dog barks again. Phoebe comes out of the room.) Oh, good, there you are! Listen, um, I have a dog in my room.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What is it doing here?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, I’m watching it for some friends who went out of town. Wait. (She bends down, picks up the dog, and waves with one of its paws) Hello, my name is Clunkers. May I please stay with you nice people?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oooh, I wish she could stay here, but Chandler is allergic!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Extremely allergic, okay? If I’m anywhere near a dog for more than 5 minutes, my throat will just close up!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That’s odd, ’cause this dog’s been living here for the past 3 days

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler, if that dog’s been here that long, and you haven’t had a reaction, maybe you’re not allergic to this dog?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, it still has to go, right?

content.speaker: Monica and Phoebe
content.text: Why?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, it’s um…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Don’t do it!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Don’t do what?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I have to! Okay? It’s time! (Joey shrugs as if to say, “Do what you have to do”) Okay, I hate dogs.

content.speaker: All
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Are you crazy?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Are you out of your mind?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Why?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Told ya. (Waves bye-bye.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: They are needy, they are jumpy, and you can’t tell what they are thinking, and that scares me a little bit.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Right, they are scary. (He jumps up, screaming) Ahh, she just ate a treat out of my hand!!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wait a minute. Do you not like all dogs? I mean, not even puppies?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Is there a puppy here?

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: You don’t like puppies?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, you are new!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look, Chandler, I told you, never tell anyone about this dog thing. It’s like Ross not likin’ ice cream.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You don’t like ice cream?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s too cold.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, it’s just that dogs make me a little uncomfortable.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It hurts my teeth.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And I don’t wanna say this, I don’t want you guys to hate me, but uh, I don’t think, I can be around that dog anymore. Okay, so either the dog goes, or I go. (An awkward silence ensues.) Oh my god!!
[Time lapse, Ross is still doing Chandler’s game. Tag is heading for the balcony.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: How can I not get this? I’m a college professor; I got 1450 on my S.A.T.s.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Damn, I forgot you were here.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right. We’re gonna take Clunkers to Ross’s. We’ll be back in a minute. (Gets up with Monica to do so.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, wait before you guys go, can I just ask you a question?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: When a guy breaks up with his girlfriend, what is an appropriate amount of time to wait before you make a move?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I’d say about a month.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really? I’d say 3 to 4.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Half hour. (Rachel turns to look at him and he nods yes.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Interesting.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: When it’s your assistant, I would say never.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, Rach, the big question is, does he like you? All right? Because if he doesn’t like you, this is all a moo-point.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Huh. A moo-point?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, it’s like a cow’s opinion. It just doesn’t matter. It’s moo.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Have I been living with him for too long, or did that all just make sense?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Please, don’t listen to Joey, okay. Would you look at him? He-he’s obviously depressed. He’s away from his family; he’s spending Thanksgiving with strangers. What he needs right now is for you to be his friend.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You’re right, I’m sorry. Thank you. Okay, that’s what I’m gonna do.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Fine! Take their advice. No one ever listens to me. When the package is this pretty, no one cares what’s inside.
[Cut to the balcony, Tag is looking down while Rachel enters.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: How are you holding up?

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Not bad.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah? I’m sorry about your girlfriend.

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Thanks.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So were you guys together a long time?

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: A year. On and off. I kinda thought we’d end up together. I don’t anymore.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Now that she broke up with you?

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah. Hmmmm.

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: It’s weird. I always used to assume, that I would meet someone and fall in love and be happy and all that was just a given. But lately it’s like what if it’s not. Do you ever have that feeling?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No…Yeah, all the time, constantly. It’s terrifying. But you know that I figure it…it has to work out.

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Why?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Because, uh—it has to.

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: You have all the answers, don’t you?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, I know, I do. I really do.

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Hey, thanks for talking to me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, what is a boss for? Hug it out! (They hug)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, he likes you back! Huh? Told ya, you should go for it!

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Street noise drowned any of that out? (Rachel moves madly towards him) No, all right, I see you later, okay… (Turns away embarrassed)

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: What did Joey say? I like you back?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh, yeah, well, see, he… Joey knows, that I’m-I’m very insecure about my back and, and…you’re hugging me, so obviously you are not repulsed by it, yeah!

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Wait-wait a minute; that doesn’t make any sense.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No? (He shakes his head) All right, here’s the truth um, Joey said what he said, because um, I’m attracted to you.

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Wow. (He starts to walk towards the railing.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, I admit it. I have a crush on you, and uh, and, and I know that’s crazy because we work together, and-and nothing could ever happen, and the last thing I want to do is-is to freak you out or make you feel uncomfortable. Which is why it would be really great if you said something right about now.

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Oh my god! Those guys are stealing my car! (He points down to the street)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Right there! That’s my car! (Sound of a breaking car-window) Hey!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, that’s gonna take them a minute. Do you have anything else you wanna get off your chest?

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: I can’t believe this! (He walks back in again)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wait, we still have time to talk and they’re-they’re not even in the car yet! (She takes a quick look down the street.) Oh look, there they go, okay. (She hurries in too)

content.description: Ross’ apartment, Monica and Phoebe sitting on the floor next to Clunkers basket.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay Phoebe, we should probably go back now.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Please don’t leave me, I’ll be lonely.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Stop it. Stop! Okay let’s go. We can be strong.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, okay.
[They both get up and head for the door. Clunkers whines a little]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my god! Did you hear that? She said Monica! (She goes back to Clunkers again) Oooh, I can’t leave her!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You know if you want, we can sneak the dog back in and Chandler wouldn’t even know.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s not gonna work.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’ve had that dog there for three days and Chandler had no idea. He’s not so smart.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey! I didn’t know either.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, but you kinda knew that something was going on, didn’t you?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, I knew.

content.description: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s. Ross lays a lot of small papers, shaped like the U.S. states onto the floor making a map with the states. Phoebe enters

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Where’s Chandler?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Here I am.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wash your hands!!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: How did you…know? (Heads back into the bathroom)
[Phoebe waves Monica in. Monica sneaks in with the bag with Clunkers in it and heads for Phoebe’s room.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey! What’s she doing back here?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Relax, Ross. She’s not made of ice cream!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey look, Phoebe. I, uh, I laid out the states geographically…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, no, we don’t really have time for this right now. Okay, we have to keep Chandler away from my bedroom.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, but, but look what I’m…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: See, this is exactly what we do not have time for. (She rushes into her room)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Where’s Monica?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Um, in Phoebe’s room. You can’t go in there.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why not?
(We can hear the dog whining at a high pitch.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Monica’s crying. She’s very upset about this whole Clunkers thing.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I, I should go in there.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No. No, no. She doesn’t want to see you right now.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why not?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Because you sent away the dog!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: This is ridiculous. (He heads for Phoebe’s bedroom)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, is it? Is it ? Look, when Monica and I were kids, we had a dog named Rover. And, uh, one day, my dad decides, he doesn’t like dogs. So Monica and her friend…Phyllis…take away the dog. And that was the last time we ever saw him. Don’t you see? This is just like that. Only with a few details changed.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, I’m in my sweat pants. Bring on the food! (Sees that Chandler has a worried look on his face) What’s the matter?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Monica’s all upset, because I sent Clunkers away.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So? Bring the dog back, you’re a hero.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I can be a hero, I could do that. I could, I could do… I, w-w-what if, what if it attacks me?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Chandler, it’s like a big gerbil.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And that doesn’t scare you? (He walks out)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ross, you need some help?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: From you? (He does a weird desperate laughter, like he’s almost crying) Yes, please!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: First of all, Utah? Dude, you can’t just make stuff up!
[Time lapse, Ross still laying a lot out the states.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I hate America! When I finish this game, I swear I am moving.
[Joey stands up again. Rachel enters the door]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! Tag’s still talking to the police.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, ohh! Why, damnit, why did I open my mouth? (In a girlish voice) I have a crush on you; I am attracted to you. (Back to normal again) Gee, I-I know that I freaked him out

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: If you said it like that, you probably did, yeah.
[Rachel walks past Joey towards the couch]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey, is Chandler here?
content.parenthetical: opens her bedroom door and peeks out

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, no he went for a walk.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, but you cannot tell him… but look who’s back!
[The dog barks, runs out of Phoebe’s room and jumps onto the couch]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh No-no-no-no-no-no-no! He went over to Ross’ to bring the dog back here!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh no, the dog’s not going to be there!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You think?
[The door opens and Chandler comes in. Rachel covers the door with a blanket]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi, honey.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Please, please, please, don’t be mad at me.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What? Why, why would…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Shh, wait and see. Maybe we will, maybe we won’t.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, I went over to Ross’ apartment to bring back Clunkers. Y’know, for you, and…(Clears his throat) I left the door open and she must have gotten out and I looked everywhere , all over the apartment, including the roof, which FYI Ross, one of your neighbors, growing weed. I couldn’t find him, and I am so, so, so, sorry. But I do know where we could all go ease the pain. (Points up and then over to the street)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: We have good news, look who’s back!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Clunkers?! Oh my god!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s right, she came back all by herself.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s a Thanksgiving miracle!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It is so good to see you!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, she came all the way back from Ross’ building. Oh, the things she must have seen! And then she climbed up the fire escape and she tapped on the window with her teeny little paw and then we ran to let her in…(Realizes, that Chandler starts to not believe her) I went too far, didn’t I? When should I have stopped?
[Time lapse, after dinner. Ross stands up from his self-made map.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, maybe this is so hard, because there aren’t 50 states. Let me tell you something, I have 49 states, and there are no more! I-I think, I should be able to eat something.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s up to you.
[Ross whines and starts working again. The door opens and Tag enters.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, hi! How are you doing?

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: I’m okay. I gotta go down to the police station and look at mug shots.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Thanks for having me over, you guys.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Tag? Y-You’re going? (Comes over to Tag) Uh we didn’t, uh we didn’t get the chance to talk. Uh, so, where did you say you’re from again?

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Colorado.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ah, what good are you. (Walks back to his map dejectedly.)
[Rachel and Tag go into the hall.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Look, um, I think we should talk about what happened on the terrace.

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ah, I-I never should have said what I said. It—y’know what? It just doesn’t matter how I feel. I mean we work together, so nothing could really ever happen between us, and what I would love is just to go to work on Monday, and-and never talk about this again, okay? Big day Monday lots to do. So, we’re okay?

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Um, I’m not.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, god, I knew it, that I freaked you out.

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: No, you didn’t. The only thing that freaked me out was you saying that nothing could ever happen between us.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Yeah, so, please don’t fire me for doing this. (He kisses her)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, well, that’s one less thing we have to do on Monday.

content.description: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s, later that night, there is someone knocking on the door and Chandler stumbles out into the living room, turns on the light, looks through the peephole, and opens the door.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Delaware! (Starting to cry.) Delaware!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I want my turkey now!
content.parenthetical: hands Chandler his pad and walks in

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You got it. (Starts looking at the pad, while Ross gets the turkey out of the fridge and starts to unwrap it) You got Nevada twice.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I know.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah. (Throws the pad on the table and heads for the bedroom)
